trans-unit.source: Network Server sample programs for embedded and client connections

seg-source.mrk: Network Server sample programs for embedded and client connections

target.mrk: Network Server sample programs for embedded and client connections

trans-unit.source: This <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program demonstrates how to obtain an embedded connection and client connections to the same database by using the Network Server. This program shows how to use either the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> or a DataSource to obtain client connections.

seg-source.mrk: This <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program demonstrates how to obtain an embedded connection and client connections to the same database by using the Network Server.
This program shows how to use either the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> or a DataSource to obtain client connections.

target.mrk: This <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program demonstrates how to obtain an embedded connection and client connections to the same database by using the Network Server.
This program shows how to use either the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> or a DataSource to obtain client connections.

trans-unit.source: sample programs for embedded and client connections

seg-source.mrk: sample programs for embedded and client connections

target.mrk: sample programs for embedded and client connections

trans-unit.source: For a database to be consistent, only one JVM can access it at a time. The embedded driver is loaded when the Network Server is started. The JVM that starts the Network Server can obtain an embedded connection to the same database that the Network Server is accessing to serve clients from other JVMs. This solution provides the performance benefits of the embedded driver and also allows client connections from other JVMs to connect to the same database.

seg-source.mrk: For a database to be consistent, only one JVM can access it at a time.
The embedded driver is loaded when the Network Server is started.
The JVM that starts the Network Server can obtain an embedded connection to the same database that the Network Server is accessing to serve clients from other JVMs.
This solution provides the performance benefits of the embedded driver and also allows client connections from other JVMs to connect to the same database.

The JVM that starts the Network Server can obtain an embedded connection to the same database that the Network Server is accessing to serve clients from other JVMs.
This solution provides the performance benefits of the embedded driver and also allows client connections from other JVMs to connect to the same database.
